alert.note: Alert for Kootenai; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 27 at 12:24PM MST until March 04 at 3:40PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Kootenai and Shoshone Counties. .Heavy rain may fall on snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Coeur d`Alene River...including Cataldo...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 44.0 feet, Homes near the river may experience some flooding of basements. Water will begin to cover CCC Road near the Mennonite Church. Some water will be over the section of Latour Creek Road immediately south of Interstate 90, near the campground. Due to the high water table some homes behind the Cataldo levee will be surrounded by water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PST Sunday the stage was 33.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 43.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM PST.
